parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions PSD (Partidul Social Democrat) and its leader Marcel Ciolacu,  promoting them and their actions.  It also implicitly contrasts PSD with USR and PNL, negatively portraying the latter two. This directly relates to Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed for wide public reach. The language used ("Dragi prieteni," "Oameni buni") and the overall message aim to address a broad audience, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The primary objective of the post is to persuade voters to support PSD in the upcoming parliamentary elections.  The post highlights PSD's achievements, contrasts them with perceived failures of other parties, and explicitly calls for votes for PSD. This clearly aims to influence the electoral outcome, satisfying Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post presents some factual information (economic data, Schengen accession), it does so selectively and within a strongly biased narrative designed to promote PSD.  The tone is not objective or neutral; it's overtly partisan and promotional, lacking the characteristics of journalistic reporting.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post goes beyond expressing a personal opinion. It uses persuasive language, statistical data (though potentially cherry-picked), and direct calls to action to promote a specific political party and influence voting behavior.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2252869808418948</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes PSD, highlighting positive economic indicators and achievements while negatively portraying opposing parties.  The post directly encourages voters to support PSD on election day.  The use of paid advertising on a public platform amplifies the message's reach and impact.  While some factual information is presented, the overall tone and objective are clearly partisan and promotional, aiming to influence the election results.  The post's content and context strongly suggest it constitutes electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Marcel Ciolacu</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>PSD</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>USR</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>PNL</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>

</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PSD</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Laurențiu Marin, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 2252869808418948) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează Partidul Social Democrat (PSD) și pe Marcel Ciolacu, prezentând date economice selective într-un mod tendențios pentru a influența votul alegătorilor. Postarea conține apeluri directe la vot pentru PSD, comparând favorabil realizările partidului cu presupusele eșecuri ale USR și PNL,  având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea PSD.  Conținutul și contextul postării, coroborate cu faptul că este o postare plătită pe o platformă publică, demonstrează clar intenția de a face propagandă electorală după încheierea perioadei legale.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
